title: Pat Cummins returns as captain as Australia announce ODI squad vs Pakistan
body:
Australia captain Pat Cummins will warm up for the Test series against India with a 3-match ODI series against Pakistan. Australia announced their 14-member squad for the home series against Pakistan, which is scheduled to be played in November, just before the Border Gavaskar Trophy.

Cummins has been resting since Australia's T20 World Cup 2024 campaign. The fast bowler had a brief stint in the Major League Cricket this season and has been resting for the past two months after that.

advertisement

Australia announced their squad early on Monday morning, 14 October, which saw a good mix of youth and experience. Talented Jake Fraser-McGurk has been given another chance to solidify his position in the ODI team, having played only one match (T20I) in the England series.

Australia squad vs Pakistan

Pat Cummins (c), Sean Abbott, Cooper Connolly, Jake Fraser-McGurk, Aaron Hardie, Josh Hazlewood, Josh Inglis, Marnus Labuschagne, Glenn Maxwell, Matthew Short, Steve Smith, Mitchell Starc, Marcus Stoinis, Adam Zampa

Australia vs Pakistan: Fixtures

First ODI: November 4: Melbourne

Second ODI: November 8: Adelaide

Third ODI: November 10: Perth

After the ODI series against Pakistan, Australia will take on India in a 5-match Test series - the Border Gavaskar Trophy. Australia also announced their squad for the tour games against India A, which is set to feature fast bowlers Scott Boland and Michael Neser, alongside young batting prodigy Sam Konstas.

The BGT is set to be a showpiece bilateral series between the two sides and could be crucial in deciding who plays the final of the World Test Championship next year, Australia are the reigning WTC champions, having beaten India in the final back in 2023.
summary:
* Pat Cummins, the Australian captain, had a brief stint in the Major League Cricket this season.
* After his stint in the Major League Cricket, Cummins has been resting for the past two months.

No other information about the Major League Cricket tournament is mentioned in the article. The rest of the article focuses on Australia's ODI series against Pakistan, the squad selection, and the upcoming Test series against India.

title: TSU vs Rashi
body:
Rashid Khan

Rashid Khan Arman is an Afghan international cricketer and captain of the Afghanistan national team in T20I format. In franchise leagues, he plays for Gujarat Titans in the Indian Premier League (IPL), Adelaide Strikers in Australia's Big Bash League (BBL), Lahore Qalandars in the Pakistan Super League (PSL), Band-e-Amir Dragons in Afghanistan's Shpageeza Cricket League and MI New York in Major League Cricket (MLC).

Lesia Tsurenko

Lesia Viktorivna Tsurenko is a Ukrainian tennis player. Tsurenko has won four singles titles on the WTA Tour, as well as six singles titles and eight doubles titles on the ITF Circuit.

Kintetsu Liners

Kintetsu Liners rugby team are a Japanese rugby union team owned by Kintetsu Corporation which was founded in 1929. They have won the All-Japan Championship three times as an amateur team.

Artsul Futebol Clube

Artsul Futebol Clube, usually known simply as Artsul, is a Brazilian football team from the city of Nova Igua√ßu in the state of Rio de Janeiro, founded on 19 June 2001. It is part of the Grupo Artsul, a company specialising in concrete.

Mitsubishi Sagamihara DynaBoars

Mitsubishi Dynaboars also known as Mitsubishi Juko Sagamihara Rugby Club, are a Japanese rugby union team based in Sagamihara, Kanagawa Prefecture, Japan. The owner of this club is Mitsubishi Heavy Industries.

Utsunomiya Brex

Utsunomiya Brex is a Japanese professional basketball team based in Tochigi Prefecture, Japan. After winning the JBL 2 in 2008, the team played in the National Basketball League.

Gamba Osaka

Gamba Osaka are a Japanese professional football club based in Suita, Osaka Prefecture. The club plays in the J1 League, which is the top tier of football in the country.

Betsukai, Hokkaido

Betsukai is a town located in Nemuro Subprefecture, Hokkaido, Japan. As of April 30, 2017, the town has an estimated population of 15,179, and an area of 1,320.15 km2 (the second largest in Hokkaido).

Rashi

Shlomo Yitzchaki , generally known by the acronym Rashi, was a medieval French rabbi, the author of comprehensive commentaries on the Talmud and Hebrew Bible. Acclaimed for his ability to present the basic meaning of the text in a concise and lucid fashion, Rashi's commentaries appeal to both learned scholars and beginning students, and his works remain a centerpiece of contemporary Torah study.
